definitions.text: lack of integrity or honesty (especially susceptibility to bribery); use of a position of trust for dishonest gain
in a state of progressive putrefaction
decay of matter (as by rot or oxidation)
moral perversion; impairment of virtue and moral principles
examples: the luxury and corruption among the upper classes
its brothels, its opium parlors, its depravity
Rome had fallen into moral putrefaction

definitions.text: destroying someone's (or some group's) honesty or loyalty; undermining moral integrity
examples: the big city's subversion of rural innocence

definitions.text: inducement (as of a public official) by improper means (as bribery) to violate duty (as by commiting a felony)
examples: he was held on charges of corruption and racketeering
